ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Queues Are exhasted
ygData.msgSnippet: This is a wholly normal state for a crawl that s still working on one queue. 10 exhausted means that 10 queues once had URIs in them, but finished. 1

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Queues Are exhasted
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=PGRlkfVQ5BuRz-ZxUlVXryL919hCJ2DPxw6QivJJBdZT
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

This is a wholly normal state for a crawl that's still working on one queue.

"10 exhausted" means that 10 queues once had URIs in them, but finished.

"1 in-process" means one queue has offered up a URI which is in the 
middle of a processing cycle. Looking at the frontier report will reveal 
which queue offered the URI, the count of other URIs in that queue, and 
other details. Looking at the threads report will reveal the processor 
currently working on the in-process URI.

With a single queue still holding URIs, and normal politeness settings, 
you would expect on subsequent viewings of this summary to see the queue 
bouncing from 'in-process' to 'snoozed' and back, until the queue is 
exhausted. If occasionally new URIs are discovered on other hosts, other 
queues might reenter active crawling as well.

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/26/10 10:00 AM, yotpo.official wrote:
> I am running with 10 threads and 10 queues and this is my frontier summary after a while:
>
>   RUN - 11 URI queues: 1 active (1 in-process; 0 ready; 0 snoozed); 0 inactive; 0 ineligible; 0 retired; 10 exhausted
>
> Anybody knows why is it happening?
>
> Thank you very much
>
>
